title: Number of earthquakes , by country 1900 to 2016
summary: This statistic shows the percent share of gold as compared to the total central bank reserves of the countries with the largest gold holdings worldwide , as of the fourth quarter of 2018 . At that point , the united states central bank kept nearly 75 percent of its total monetary holdings as gold reserves .
gold: From 1990 to 2016 , China was the country with highest amount of earthquakes . Between that time period , they reported 157 earthquakes . Indonesia , Iran , Turkey , and Japan rounded out the top five countries with the most earthquakes .
